title: State Dept number two aware of Giuliani campaign on...
text:
US Deputy Secretary of State John Sullivan says he was aware of a campaign against the US ambassador to Ukraine

The State Department's number two official said Wednesday he knew of a campaign by President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani against the US ambassador in Ukraine, a key part of the impeachment inquiry.

Deputy Secretary of State John Sullivan faced rare open questions from lawmakers as a Senate committee considered his nomination by Trump to be ambassador to Russia.

Democratic senators asked Sullivan whether Giuliani had tried to "smear" Marie Yovanovitch, a career diplomat whom Trump allegedly wanted to remove as ambassador to Ukraine for perceived disloyalty.

"I was aware that Mr. Giuliani was involved in Ukraine issues," Sullivan told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

"My knowledge of it -- particularly in the April, May, June timeframe, even in July -- was focused on his campaign basically against our ambassador to Ukraine," he said.

Sullivan insisted that both he and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo pushed back against criticism of Yovanovitch led by Giuliani, the former mayor of New York who serves as Trump's personal attorney.

"I told her I had no reason to believe at the time that she had done anything" wrong, Sullivan said.

But he said that Trump can decide to remove any ambassador "when he loses confidence," including Sullivan if confirmed to Moscow.

Yovanovitch testified behind closed doors earlier this month to House impeachment investigators, with her leaked remarks saying that Trump had been pushing since mid-2018 to remove her.

Trump is facing impeachment over allegations that he abused the power of the presidency to pressure Ukraine into digging for dirt on domestic opponent Joe Biden and thus influence the 2020 election.

Yovanovitch returned to Washington months before her scheduled departure.

In a rought transcript released by the White House of Trump's July 25 phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, Trump described "the woman" who was ambassador as "bad news."
